intro: Angelica forsteriana, commonly known as the dwarf angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Angelica forsteriana is valued for its medicinal properties and its role in supporting local wildlife.
